intro: Myrsine manglillo, commonly known as the mangrove myrsine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers that are followed by dark, round berries. It typically grows in coastal areas, often in brackish or saltwater environments. Myrsine manglillo plays a role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various marine and terrestrial species.
